description: From Middle English wedsetten, equivalent to wed (“pledge”) +‎ set. Wad is a Scottish form of wed.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, Scotland) The conveyance of land in pledge for a debt; a mortgage.
examples: It was at this time that Rob Roy acquired an interest by purchase, wadset, or otherwise, to the property of Craig Royston already mentioned.

verbs.description: wadset (third-person singular simple present wadsets, present participle wadsetting, simple past and past participle wadsetted)

examples: I thought I heard the footstep of the young portioner of Glaiketha; he'll be come to borrow gold and to wadset land.
